title: Sister of Ivan Susin who died in Gold Coast brawl reveals fake fundraising pages have been made
text:
A heartbroken sister who lost her brother after he was allegedly killed in a brawl over hot chips has revealed fake fundraising pages are being set up in his memory.

Brazilian man Ivan Susin, 29, was allegedly assaulted outside a kebab shop on Orchid Avenue in Surfers Paradise about 1am on October 1, leaving him in a coma for 12 days before he died.

His sister, Joseane Susin, is due to land on the Gold Coast on Monday morning to bring her brother's body home to Brazil.

Writing on her Facebook page on Sunday, Ms Susin urged her friends not to contribute any money to fundraisers in her brother's name.

Ivan Susin (pictured) lost his life after he was allegedly beaten in a brawl in Surfer's Paradise last month

'Friends! I hear you're getting links to help about Ivan! Please don't touch anything because I didn't do it,' she said on Facebook.

She said that she was on her way to Australia and had no internet access to create the pages.

'When there is a link to help I announce here!'

In a previous post following the news of her brother's death, Ms Susin had said it was an act of 'barbarism'.

'The barbarism committed against a 29-year-old boy who, going to Australia to fulfill his first dreams loses his life, can never be understood,' she wrote.

'However, the search for justice will be not (the) only reason to continue alive, but essentially so that Ivan Susin, Brazilian, son, brother, friend and human being of indescribable kindness, will never be forgotten.'

During the time of the brawl, Mr Susin was sitting with friends on a bench outside a kebab shop when two men, one believed to be Ricky Lefoe, 27, and another 28-year-old, approached the group.

Brazilian man Ivan Susin (pictured), 29, was allegedly assaulted outside a kebab shop on Orchid Avenue in Surfers Paradise about 1am on October 1

Mr Susin was sitting with friends on a bench outside a kebab shop when two men, one believed to be Ricky Lefoe, 27, and another 28-year-old, approached the group

According to police, one of the men took a hot chip from the group before chaos ensued.

CCTV footage obtained by 9News shows Mr Susin jumping into the fight and throwing a punch.

Mr Susin is then seen being punched in the face, causing him to fall to the ground and hit his head before losing consciousness.

The 29-year-old was rushed to Gold Coast University Hospital in a serious condition, where he was in a coma for 12 days before he died on Friday.

The two men involved in the fight allegedly ran from the scene before witnesses contacted police.

CCTV footage shows Mr Susin jumping into the fight and throwing a punch (pictured)

Mr Lefoe was charged with one count of grievous bodily harm but was bailed on $50,000 surety and is yet to enter a plea.

His lawyer, Campbell MacCallum said Mr Lefoe had 'expressed his genuine sorry to the young man's family' after hearing the news of his death, The Gold Coast Bulletin reported.

Queensland Police expect to upgrade the charges when he appears in court on October 16.

Another 28-year-old man who is believed to have been involved in the brawl was charged with one count of stealing and two counts of assault occasioning bodily harm, to appear in court on Monday.

A tribute was held at the Calvary Catholic Church in Miami, where many gathered in respect for Mr Susin.
